III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation During an outing on an unknown date youth stuck his penis in
another youth's butt while in the bathroom. Youth was required to
have one to one supervision at the time.
Investigation Interviews:
On 8/26/24 Chief Administrator reported an allegation that Youth
A and Youth B had inappropriate contact while on an outing to
Belle Isle in Detroit. Youth A reported to staff that while on the
outing Youth B put his penis in Youth A’s butt. The date was
unknown at the time of the report. However, Youth A indicated it
occurred three days after he was placed at the facility. Youth A
was placed on 6/19/24, but there were no outings to Belle Isle in
June 2024. Youth A was on one-to-one staffing since placement,
therefore there was concern about the supervision provided during
the outing.
On 9/12/24 Chief Administrator reported they were able to
determine the visit to Belle Isle occurred on 7/4/24 or 7/13/24.
However, it was noted that Youth A did not participate in any
activities on 7/4/24 and did not attend the outing on 7/13/24. Chief
Administrator provided a list of youth and staff that attended.
Follow-up occurred with Chief Administrator on 9/26/24. Chief
Administrator provided the agency’s supervision policy and
clarified there is not a specific policy for one-to-one supervision.
Youth A was not interviewed during the initial on-site visit on
9/4/24 as he was AWOL. Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at
the facility on 9/12/24. Youth A verified he had one-to-one staffing.
Youth A stated that he knew Youth B. Youth A could not recall any
2

details about a trip to Belle Isle. Youth A refused to continue the
interview.
Youth B was not interviewed during the initial on-site visit on
9/4/24 as he was moved to another facility on 8/30/24. Youth B
was interviewed face-to-face on 10/1/24. Youth B reported he had
one-to-one staffing at Wolverine. Youth B stated the staff always
stayed with him and never left him alone, or with other youth.
Youth B recalled a trip to Belle Isle and stated that staff were
always with the kids, supervising throughout the trip. When asked
about the bathroom, Youth B stated only one youth was allowed in
the bathroom at a time, and staff stood outside the door. If it were
a female staff, they would ask a male staff to go in to check on the
youth if needed. No other youth were allowed in the bathroom if
one youth was already in there.
Youth B reported Youth A was not on that outing. Youth B stated
that he did not want to talk about Youth A, as he did not like him.
Youth B said Youth A was annoying and would spit on people.
Youth B would typically avoid Youth A. Youth B recalled that
Youth A also had one-to-one staffing due to his behavior.
Youth C moved from the facility prior to the investigation. Youth C
was interviewed face-to-face at his new placement on 9/30/24.
Youth C reported that he remembered going to Belle Isle with
Youth A, but he did not remember Youth B being there. Youth C
reported that one-to-one staff always stayed with youth while he
was there. Youth C recalled Youth B had one-to-one staffing and
never saw staff leave Youth B’s side.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 9/4/24. Staff
1 reported he was not present for any outing to Belle Isle with
Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 never observed any sexual activity
between the youth and did not have any concerns about their
interactions.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 9/12/24.
Staff 2 reported he was not present for any outing to Belle Isle
with Youth A and Youth B. Staff 2 did not have any concerns or
observations of inappropriate behavior between the two youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 9/24/24 in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 stated she recalled going on an outing to
Belle Isle. However, she could not remember the specific date.
Although she noted that Youth A did not attend many outings due
to his frequent truancy. Staff 3 recalled being Youth A’s one-to-
3

one staff. Staff 3 reported she always had Youth A within arms-
reach. Staff 3 did not see or hear of any inappropriate contact
between Youth A and Youth B. Staff 3 stated there never would
have been an opportunity for contact between the two youth, as
staff were always with them. Staff 3 reported that Youth A had a
habit of yelling that he was being sexually assaulted when he was
upset. This appeared to be a defense mechanism when Youth A
felt uncomfortable and wanted people to back away. This was
documented in prior investigations completed by DCWL.
Staff 4 was interviewed by phone on 9/24/24 in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 was terminated from the agency in July
2024. Staff 4 did not recall being present for any outings to Belle
Isle attended by Youth B. Staff 4 stated she was not familiar with
Youth A and did not recall working with him. Staff 4 never heard
any reports of sexual contact between Youth A and Youth B.
Staff 5 was interviewed by phone on 9/24/24 in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported that he went on several outings
to Belle Isle with youth over the summer. Staff 5 could not recall a
time when both Youth A and Youth B attended the outing
together. Staff 5 stated he never heard any allegation of sexual
contact between Youth A and Youth B. Staff 5 recalled that both
youths were on one-to-one staffing for most of their time at the
agency. Staff 5 stated he always saw staff with both youth and did
not believe there was ever a time the youth were alone. Staff 5
reported that Youth A had a history of yelling rape or making false
allegations against youth or staff when he was upset.
Staff 6 was interviewed by phone on 9/24/24 in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker. Staff 6 recalled going on several trips to Belle
Isle with youth over the summer. Staff 6 stated that to his
knowledge Youth A and Youth B never attended an outing to Belle
Isle together. Staff 6 never heard any allegations of sexual contact
between the youth. Staff 6 stated that both youths had one-to-one
staffing, which would make it impossible for them to be alone
together. Staff 6 reported that he never saw one-to-one staff leave
a youth alone or with peers unsupervised.
Case Manager was interviewed by phone on 9/25/24. Case
Manager stated that she did not have any knowledge of Youth A
and Youth B interacting inappropriately. Case Manager was aware
of an incident on 7/13/24, where Youth B removed his swimsuit in
the pool at Belle Isle. However, Youth A was not present at that
outing.
4

Documents reviewed
An incident report dated 7/4/24 indicated that while traveling to the
park at Belle Isle Youth A requested to return to the facility. Youth
A was informed that they could not go back at that time. Upon
arriving at the park, Youth A had several behavioral outbursts and
eventually refused to participate in activities. Youth A sat in the
van with staff for the duration of the outing.
Analysis Based on interviews with youth and staff there is no information to
support the allegation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
